RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 87. Allowance Purse 30500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 23 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowa nces)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUBA'S NOTION rated a short lead inside, came under pressure past the three eighths pole, raced clear at the rail on the far turn, dug in under steady stretch encouragement and just lasted. NAPA VALLEY was strung five wide on the opening turn, left the turn outside and bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced close in the four path on the far turn then dueled through the stretch for second while gaining on the winner. SPUNMAN saved ground, bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn then outfinished in the stretch duel for second. VIOLENT ROCK stalked four wide on the first turn, left the turn toward the outside and gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced close two deep on the far turn but flattened the final sixteenth. MACHEN'S RIDGE became a bit edgy in the gate then stalked two deep, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn, altered course from the heels of rivals mid-stretch but flattened the remaining sixteenth. FEARNOUGHT raced three wide on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and showed little in the lane. RUN TO DAYLIGHT was strung six wide into the first turn, moved in a bit leaving the turn but showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Juba's Notion
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated short lead inside,pressured past 3/8,clear turn,just lasted

ENTRY.NAME: Spunman
ENTRY.OWNER: Boyer James A and Coleswood Farm Inc

ENTRY.NAME: Machen's Ridge
ENTRY.COMMENT: edgy gate,stalked 2d,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,flattened late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 45. Maiden Claiming Purse 14400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SMALL PAW bobbled then exchanged contact with Jubay leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch and challenged J. WICK leaving the turn, dug in determinedly through the final furlong and eked out the nod in later yards. The latter set a pressured pace, contested the rail on the turn, dug in gamely leaving the turn but relented the nod through later yards. JUBAY exchanged contact with Small Paw leaving the gate then picked up the chase outside, raced in the five path on the turn and came along for third later yards. JUBA'S YANKEE ONE gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn then flattened later yards. WINDSOR'S STAR pressured the early pace, raced off the rail on the turn then weakened the final sixteenth. BOO TOO pressured the pace inside but dropped back at the rail midway on the turn and weakened in the lane. KING KJARTAN saved ground. The Stewards reviewed, then dismissed a claim of foul against the rider of J. Wick for alleged interference on the turn, lodged by the rider of Windsor's Star.

ENTRY.NAME: Boo Too
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace inside,dropped back rail mid turn,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Jubay
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,chased outside,5p turn,along 3rd later yards

ENTRY.NAME: J. Wick
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,game to late lane,relented

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Allowance Purse 31600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 23 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since April 23 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15, 000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THE ILLUSIONIST chased toward the inside, raced at the rail on the turn, eased out entering the stretch and dug in to take the nod in the final strides. PINK DINGHY set a pressured pace leaving the half mile pole and rounded the turn at the rail, his rider lost his whip nearing the eighth pole, dug in under a vigorous hand ride through the stretch but was caught in the final strides. LORD OF CORK chased outside, rounded the turn about the four path and just lasted for third. ELEANORS JACK gave chase toward mid track, raced in the six path on the turn, finished well and just missed third. NOW HOOK'EM pressured the pace through the backstretch, but dropped back leaving the quarter pole and flattened in the lane. BERTRAM FLIGHT gave close early chase outside but faded into the turn. WELL EQUIPPED dropped well back from early contention and saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Pink Dinghy
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,lost whip 1/8,caught final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Eleanors Jack
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased mid track,6p turn,finished well,just missed 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: The Illusionist
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,rail turn,eased out 1/8,nod final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Bertram Flight
ENTRY.COMMENT: close early chase outside,faded into turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 52. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SWEET FACTOR saved ground just off the pace on the opening turn then took the lead two deep at the seven sixteenths pole, was urged clear approaching the five sixteenths, rounded the far turn at the rail then kept alert in the lane. WAVERLEY came away awkwardly then saved ground on the first turn, started her bid leaving the three eighths pole, improved in the three path on the far turn, was carried out leaving the turn but dug in leaving the turn and dueled through the final sixteenth for second. TALENTED CORINNA stalked off the rail, gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn, drifted leaving the turn and was outfinished for second the final sixteenth. SUPER SWEETIE saved ground, bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. OUR GOLDEN COLLEEN rated the pace inside, was met at the seven sixteenths pole and gave chase from that point, but dropped back approaching the five sixteenths and faded at the rail on the far turn. ESTILO AMOROSO raced with the pace three wide through the front stretch, dropped back into the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but faded through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Our Golden Colleen
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,met 7/16,chased,faded rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Talented Corinna
ENTRY.OWNER: Campbell Kim and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,drifted,outfnsh 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Super Sweetie
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 3/8,off rail far turn,empty lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 59. Claiming Purse 12500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Co nsidered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BALI BALIFLY ducked in leaving the gate then took a quick lead and rated the pace, came under pressure at the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail, was steadily encouraged through the lane and just lasted. HOW IS SHE raced well off the pace and off the rail, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and steadily improved in the five path of the far turn, dug in leaving the turn, took second late stretch and just missed the win. CEDARS BULLS EYE rounded the opening turn about the three path then stalked on the second turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn then flattened later yards. SHE'S MYBUDDYBUDDY rated close off the rail, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and ran evenly down the lane. FORT ZANNA stalked two deep, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn then flattened in the stretch. TAPPING SOUTH settled back off the rail, eased out into the backstretch and gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and weakened in the lane. BOCA BIRDIE steadied at the break then saved ground, picked up the chase into the backstretch but weakened into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Bali Balifly
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked in,rated pace,pressured 3/8,rail far turn,just lasted

ENTRY.NAME: She's Mybuddybuddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close off rail,chased 7/16,3p far turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Tapping South
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off rail,eased out 1/2,chased 3/8,3p far turn,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: How Is She
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace,off rail,bid 7/16,5p far turn,up 2nd late,just miss

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 58. Maiden Special Weight Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUBA'S PARADE raced with the pace two deep and moved to even terms into the backstretch and kept the edge over SHEWEARSSTILETTOS from that point, drew clear past the quarter pole, was urged away at the rail on the far turn then steadily handled in the lane. The latter rated a slim lead inside, was met into the backstretch and gave chase from that point, dropped back past the quarter pole and had to settle for second best. MEGEEZER ducked out leaving the gate then rated close in the three path the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. LIME STAR rated close to the early pace inside, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and showed little more. WOODEN SHIPS rounded the opening turn in the three and four paths, gave chase from the three eighths pole but weakened into the far turn. FLATTERING WAY saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Lime Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 7/16,rail far turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Shewearsstilettos
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Megeezer
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out break,rated close 3p,chased 7/16,rail far turn,empty

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 90. Allowance Purse 31500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A MileO r Over Since May 23 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since April 23 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: C R'S MANDATE rated a slim lead off the rail, contested even terms at the rail on the second turn, was met into the backstretch and stalked from that point, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail, was carried out entering the stretch, dug in to recover the advantage past the eighth pole, raced clear mid-stretch and held on well. WHAT DOES IT TAKE settled just off the pace in the three and four paths, took the nod three wide past the half mile pole, contested the edge at the rail on the far turn, drifted leaving the turn, was caught past the eighth pole and relented the final sixteenth. NOBALLSTWOSTRIKES lunged at the break then stalked from the two and three paths, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail, dueled through the stretch and just lasted for third. CHROME HEIR settled back off the rail, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, improved in the three path on the far turn, drifted leaving the turn and ran evenly through the stretch. ROYAL PAIN rated close to the early pace inside, eased out leaving the second turn and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail then flattened in the lane. LOKOYA ROAD was not a factor. ARISTOCAT had a brief early lead then stayed with the early pace, raced at even terms two deep on the second turn but faded through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Chrome Heir
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off rail,chased 3/8,3p far turn,drifted 1/8,even finish

ENTRY.NAME: C R's Mandate
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead,even terms 2nd turn,met 1/2,chased,up lane,drving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 50. Maiden Special Weight Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: UNUSUALLY LUCKY got loose in the post parade and came away awkwardly, rounded the opening turn about the four path, started a bid into the backstretch and steadily improved, raced in the four path on the far turn and dug in to get up the final yards. FAR MORE raced in the six path the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path, dueled to a brief late lead but was caught the final yards. XTENDED STREAK took the lead while tapering to the inside and rated the pace, widened through the backstretch, rounded the far turn at the rail, dug in under steady handling leaving the turn but was caught flattening stride inside the sixteenth pole. CANDY LOVES HONEY was shuffled back early and rounded the opening turn off the rail, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and weakened in the lane. UNALTERED moved to the inside past the five eighths pole and stalked into the backstretch, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole but weakened at the rail past the five sixteenths. VIESTE rounded the first turn about the four path, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but showed little response. WORM raced off the pace inside on the first turn then faded through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Unusually Lucky
ENTRY.COMMENT: loose parade,awkward break,long steady bid,4p turn,up late

ENTRY.NAME: Xtended Streak
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,widened from 1/2,rail far turn,flattened 1/16
